title: (x) L'Occitane de Provence - Adobe Garamond {Addison Hall}
content: Some time ago I read that one of the regular posters here has developed corporate ID for the L'Occitane. Can he or anyone else tell me what is their "corporate" font? I regularly do some advertising for them, but the local distributors know little about their graphic standards.
author: mncz

comments.content:
![images that show L'Occitane font](http://web.archive.org/web/20141003154459im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/23813.jpg) ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141003154459im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/23814.jpg)   
These images show the font used for L'Occitane logo and packaging. I'm interested about the serif face.

Adobe Garamond small caps (modified). The small cap height is a little larger than standard.   
   
At [MyFonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20141003154459/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/adobe-garamond/small-caps-and-oldstyle-figures/testdrive.html?s=lOccitane&p=72).

Might have been me you are refering to. Hrant and I had a conversation some time ago about this.   
   
I did a lot of stuff for them. Mostly Store front & environmental design. Indeed it is Adobe Garamond small caps. Indeed the sc x hieght is a little larger. and the 'O' was thinkened just slightly to accomodate for the larger xheight.
Tnx for the help. I have a different version of Garamond installed and apparently it has some minor differences from the Adobe Garamond, so I thought maybe it's something else.
